p.a: Whittier Union Students Explore Colleges at 2019-20 College Night!

h3.a: Distance Learning Extended through End of 2019-20 School Year

div.div: Click to learn more about the extension of school dismissal and what it means for the Class of 2020.
Click to learn more about the new grading guidelines that will be in place for the duration of our school dismissal period.

**UPDATED: 4/15/2020** COVID-19 UPDATE: Whittier Union High School District has extended distance learning through the end of the 2019-20 school and will continue the physical closure of its schools until further notice. The District will leave open the possibility of holding supplemental school activities, including senior functions, should the county's Safer at Home Order be revised or rescinded. Resources on nutrition and instructional programs and community resources, including mental health and free internet access during this dismissal period, are available. Please read the full announcement by clicking the "Read Full Story" below.
The coronavirus pandemic has posed difficulties, but learn how Whittier Union continues to rise to the challenge in our March Update.
